dialogue_turns.speaker: Narrator
dialogue_turns.text: 10.7 percent inflation in Kazakhstan, accelerating from March's 10 percent.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: ten point seven percent inflation in Kazakhstan, accelerating from March's ten percent.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In April, annual inflation in Kazakhstan accelerated to 10.7 percent (compared to 10 percent in March), according to the press service of the National Bank.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and it hit 13.8 percent in the capital, Astana. That's a pretty sharp jump.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and it hit thirteen point eight percent in the capital, Astana. That's a pretty sharp jump.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The highest annual inflation was observed in Astana " 13.8 percent.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Right, and food prices are a big part of that—they rose to 8.5 percent in April, up from 7.6 the month before.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, and food prices are a big part of that-they rose to eight point five percent in April, up from seven point six the month before.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Food prices rose more rapidly in April, reaching 8.5 percent (up from 7.6 percent in March).

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: But it's not even across regions, is it? Like, Akmola saw an 11.2 percent increase in food prices, while Kyzylorda and Almaty were both at just 6.8.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But it's not even across regions, is it? Like, Akmola saw an eleven point two percent increase in food prices, while Kyzylorda and Almaty were both at just six point eight.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The largest increase in food prices was recorded in the Akmola region (11.2 percent), while the smallest was in Kyzylorda region and Almaty (6.8 percent each).

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly, that regional variation is really interesting. And non-food products actually slowed a bit to 8.9 percent, but again, Turkestan was way above average at 14.8.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly, that regional variation is really interesting. And non-food products actually slowed a bit to eight point nine percent, but again, Turkestan was way above average at fourteen point eight.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The growth rate of prices for non-food products slowed in April to 8.9 percent (from 9.1 percent in March). The highest rate was in the Turkestan region (14.8 percent), and the lowest in Pavlodar region (5.9 percent).

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And then you've got paid services—15.7 percent inflation there, which is huge. Almaty's services inflation was 20 percent!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And then you've got paid servicesminus fifteen point seven percent inflation there, which is huge. Almaty's services inflation was twenty percent!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Prices for paid services accelerated in April to 15.7 percent (from 14.3 percent in March). "Prices in Almaty rose significantly above the national average (20 percent), while in Pavlodar region, they were much lower at 8.6 percent," noted the National Bank.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, that's way above the national average. Meanwhile, Pavlodar region had the lowest non-food inflation at 5.9 percent and services at only 8.6.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, that's way above the national average. Meanwhile, Pavlodar region had the lowest non-food inflation at five point nine percent and services at only eight point six.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The highest rate was in the Turkestan region (14.8 percent), and the lowest in Pavlodar region (5.9 percent). "Prices in Almaty rose significantly above the national average (20 percent), while in Pavlodar region, they were much lower at 8.6 percent," noted the National Bank.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: So overall monthly inflation for the country was 1.2 percent in April, which adds up over time.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So overall monthly inflation for the country was one point two percent in April, which adds up over time.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In April, monthly inflation across the country amounted to 1.2 percent.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: It really does. You know, when you see numbers like these, it makes you wonder how households are coping, especially in those harder-hit areas.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It really does. You know, when you see numbers like these, it makes you wonder how households are coping, especially in those harder-hit areas.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. And with inflation accelerating in 18 out of the regions, it seems like a widespread issue, not just isolated cases.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. And with inflation accelerating in eighteen out of the regions, it seems like a widespread issue, not just isolated cases.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Inflation acceleration was recorded in 18 regions of the country.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. The National Bank's gonna have its hands full trying to manage this without stifling growth.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. The National Bank's gonna have its hands full trying to manage this without stifling growth.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: No kidding. It's a tough balancing act, especially with such stark regional differences.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No kidding. It's a tough balancing act, especially with such stark regional differences.
